passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Linus Pauling was an American scientist who made significant contributions to the fields of chemistry and molecular biology. • Pauling is the only person to have won two unshared Nobel Prizes, one in Chemistry (1954) and one for Peace (1962). • His work on the nature of the chemical bond led to the development of the field of quantum chemistry. • Linus Pauling also proposed the alpha helix structure of proteins.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to highlight Linus Pauling's unique achievements?

choices.A: Linus Pauling, an American scientist, worked on the nature of the chemical bond.
choices.B: Linus Pauling, the only person to have won two unshared Nobel Prizes, made significant contributions to chemistry, molecular biology, and the development of quantum chemistry.
choices.C: Linus Pauling proposed the alpha helix structure of proteins and worked in the fields of chemistry and molecular biology.
choices.D: Linus Pauling won a Nobel Prize in Chemistry and was an influential figure in the field of molecular biology.

explanation: B: 'Linus Pauling, the only person to have won two unshared Nobel Prizes, made significant contributions to chemistry, molecular biology, and the development of quantum chemistry.' is the correct answer because it effectively highlights Pauling's unique achievements, including his two unshared Nobel Prizes and significant contributions to different scientific fields.
distractor_explanation: 'Linus Pauling, an American scientist, worked on the nature of the chemical bond.' is incorrect because it does not mention Pauling's unique achievements, such as winning two unshared Nobel Prizes.

'Linus Pauling proposed the alpha helix structure of proteins and worked in the fields of chemistry and molecular biology.' is incorrect because it does not mention Pauling's unique achievements, such as winning two unshared Nobel Prizes and contributing to the development of quantum chemistry.

'Linus Pauling won a Nobel Prize in Chemistry and was an influential figure in the field of molecular biology.' is incorrect because it does not mention Pauling's unique achievement of winning two unshared Nobel Prizes and contributing to the development of quantum chemistry.
